name: paw-workflow
description: Phased Agent Workflow tooling for VS Code - streamlines work item initialization

paw.promptDirectory.markdownDescription: Absolute path to the VS Code prompts directory. When set, PAW installs agents here instead of using the auto-detected location.

languageModelTools.name: paw_get_context
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Retrieve workspace-specific custom instructions, user-level custom instructions (if they exist), and workflow context for PAW agents. Returns formatted text with sections wrapped in XML tags: <workspace_instructions> for workspace .paw/instructions/, <user_instructions> for user ~/.paw/instructions/, and <workflow_context> for raw WorkflowContext.md content.

feature_slug.description: The normalized Work ID (also called feature slug, e.g., 'auth-system')

agent_name.description: The name of the calling agent (e.g., 'PAW-02B Impl Planner')

languageModelTools.name: paw_call_agent
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Invoke a PAW agent in a new chat session with Work ID context. Agents should intelligently map user requests to exact agent names (e.g., 'research' → 'PAW-01B Spec Researcher', 'implement Phase 2' → 'PAW-03A Implementer'). Supports inline instructions for customizing agent behavior without creating prompt files.

target_agent.description: The exact name of the PAW agent to invoke

work_id.description: The normalized Work ID (feature slug, e.g., 'auth-system')

inline_instruction.description: Optional instruction to pass to the target agent (e.g., 'Phase 2', 'add rate limiting')

languageModelTools.name: paw_generate_prompt
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Create a customizable prompt file for a PAW agent on demand. The agent must specify: 1) template_key - the base template to use (e.g., '03A-implement', '03C-pr-review'), and 2) filename - the exact output filename (e.g., '03A-implement-phase3.prompt.md'). Valid template keys: 01A-spec, 02A-code-research, 02B-impl-plan, 02C-planning-pr-review, 03A-implement, 03B-review, 03C-pr-review, 03D-review-pr-review, 04-docs, 04B-docs-pr-review, 04C-docs-review-pr-review, 05-pr, 05B-final-pr-review, 05C-final-review-pr-review, 0X-status. The agent determines the appropriate template and filename based on user intent.

work_id.description: The normalized Work ID (feature slug, e.g., 'auth-system')

template_key.description: The template key identifying which prompt template to use. This is the base filename without .prompt.md extension.

filename.description: The exact filename to use for the generated prompt file. Must end with .prompt.md extension. For standard prompts use template filename (e.g., '03A-implement.prompt.md'). For phase-specific append context (e.g., '03A-implement-phase3.prompt.md').

additional_content.description: Optional instructions to append to the prompt (e.g., 'Focus on Phase 3', 'add rate limiting').

languageModelTools.name: paw_get_skills
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Retrieve a catalog of available PAW skills with metadata. Returns skill names, descriptions, and types for the agent to select appropriate skills.

languageModelTools.name: paw_get_skill
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Retrieve the full content of a specific PAW skill by name. Use after consulting the catalog to load skills needed for the current task.

skill_name.description: The name of the skill to load
